org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon
Class DecoratorBusyIcon

java.lang.Object
  java.util.Observable
      org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon.AbstractBusyIcon
          org.divxdede.swing.busy.icon.DecoratorBusyIcon
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.swing.Icon, BusyIcon
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultBusyIcon, RadialBusyIcon
public abstract class DecoratorBusyIcon
extends AbstractBusyIcon

An implementation of the BusyIcon interface to serve as a basis for implementing Busy Icons based on another icon extended with busy capabilities.

The method setDecoratedIcon(javax.swing.Icon) can be used for change or set the decorated icon.
This icon can have a bigger size than the decorated by fixing an Insets by subclasses.
When an Insets is set, the decorated icon are centered regarding the Insets.

The decorated icon can be an animated icon (like a .gif), in this case, each time a new frame is available, a repaint event will be fired for update this icon.
For be able to catch theses new frame events, the decorated icon must be an ImageIcon or extends Observable class.

This implementation don't implements AbstractBusyIcon.paintDeterminate(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int, float) or AbstractBusyIcon.paintUndeterminate(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int, int) but offer a paintDecoratedIcon(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int) that can be used by subclasses for drawing the decorated icon.

The paintIdle(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int) is implemented by painting only the decorated icon as is (respecting insets).
You can override this method if you need to provide a more sophisticate render process for the idle state.

Since:
1.1
Author:
André Sébastien (divxdede)

Method Detail

getDecoratedIcon

public javax.swing.Icon getDecoratedIcon()
Retrieve the current decorated icon of this decorator.
A decorator busy icon extends a decorated icon with some busy-ui capabilities.

Returns:
Current decorated icon (may be null)

setDecoratedIcon

public void setDecoratedIcon(javax.swing.Icon icon)
Define the new decorated icon.

A decorator busy icon extends a decorated icon with some busy capabilities.
This method allow to change dynamically the base of this icon by setting a new decorated icon.

The decorated icon will be centered on this icon accordingly to the current Insets

Parameters:
icon - New decorated icon of this decorator (may be null)

getInsets

protected java.awt.Insets getInsets()
Retrieve current Insets of this DecoratorBusyIcon.
The decorated icon is centered on this icon accordingly to this insets.

Returns:
Insets of this icon

setInsets

protected void setInsets(java.awt.Insets insets)
Change current Insets of this DecoratorBusyIcon.

Parameters:
insets -

paintIdle

protected void paintIdle(java.awt.Component c,
                         java.awt.Graphics g,
                         int x,
                         int y)
By default, a decorator icon paint an idle state by painting the decorated icon without anything else.
If you want a more sophisticated idle icon, you should override this method.

Specified by:
paintIdle in class AbstractBusyIcon
Parameters:
c - Component using this icon
g - Graphics to paint on
x - Upper left corner (horizontal value)
y - Upper left corner (vertical value)

paintDecoratedIcon

protected void paintDecoratedIcon(java.awt.Component c,
                                  java.awt.Graphics g,
                                  int x,
                                  int y)
Paint the decorated icon using Insets for place it inside this DecoratorBusyIcon

This method should be used by subclasses when they implements:

  • AbstractBusyIcon.paintDeterminate(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int, float)
    • AbstractBusyIcon.paintUndeterminate(java.awt.Component, java.awt.Graphics, int, int, int)

getIconWidth

public int getIconWidth()
Return the width of this DecoratorBusyIcon.
Width = decorated icon width + insets.left + insets.right

Returns:
Width of this icon

getIconHeight

public int getIconHeight()
Return the height of this DecoratorBusyIcon.
Width = decorated icon height + insets.top + insets.bottom

Returns:
Width of this icon
